verses.text: 看哪！主萬軍之耶和華，快要從耶路撒冷和猶大，除掉人所倚靠的和所倚賴的，就是眾人所倚靠的糧，眾人所倚賴的水；

words.note: An emphatic particle, common in biblical text.
Refers to God or the Lord in a religious context.
Part of the title 'Lord of Hosts' (萬軍之耶和華).
Classical possessive particle, often used in biblical titles.
Forms a nominalizer, indicating 'that which is V-ed'.
Often used in a spiritual sense of relying on God.
Combines with 所 to form 'that which is relied upon'.
Similar to 倚靠, often used in a spiritual context.
Often used in scripture to mean 'all people' or 'the multitude'.

verses.text: 除掉勇士和戰士、審判官和先知、占卜的和長老、

words.note: An official who administers justice.
Lit. 'one who knows first', a messenger of God.
One who practices divination, often condemned in the Bible.
A respected senior leader in a community or church.

verses.text: 五十夫長和尊貴的人、謀士和有技藝的工人，以及精通法術的。

words.note: A military rank for a leader of fifty men.
Often implies high social status or moral standing.
One who gives counsel, especially to rulers.
In this context, referring to skilled artisans.
Often refers to occult practices, condemned in the Bible.

verses.text: 我必使孩童作他們的領袖，使嬰孩管轄他們。

words.note: Expresses strong certainty or determination.
To have administrative or political control over.

verses.text: 人民必互相壓迫，人欺壓人，也欺壓自己的鄰舍；年輕人要欺凌老年人，卑賤人必欺凌尊貴人。

words.note: To subject to harsh and authoritarian treatment.
To harass or torment others.
Often used in the Bible in a moral sense, like 'love your neighbor'.
To treat others with contempt and abuse.
Refers to low social status or position.

verses.text: 人若在父家裡，拉住自己一個兄弟，說：「你有一件外衣，你就作我們的官長吧！這敗落的事就歸你的手處理。」

words.note: Refers to one's patriarchal family.
Refers to a governing official.
Indicates suggestion or mild command.
Often refers to national or moral decay.

verses.text: 那時，那人必高聲說：「我不作醫治你們的人（「醫治你們的人」直譯是「包紥創傷的」）」因為我家裡沒有糧食，也沒有外衣，你們不要立我作人民的官長。」

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase like 'the one who bandages wounds'.
Refers to a governing official.

verses.text: 耶路撒冷敗落，猶大傾倒，是因為他們的舌頭和行為都敵對耶和華，惹怒了他那充滿榮光的眼目。

words.note: Implies a state of moral or physical decay.
Often used for kingdoms or cities falling.
Figuratively refers to one's words or speech.
Indicates a completed action or change of state.
Refers to divine glory.
A more formal or literary term for 'eyes'.

verses.text: 他們面上的表情指證他們的不對；他們像所多瑪一般宣揚自己的罪惡，並不隱瞞；他們有禍了，因為他們自招禍害。

words.note: Indicates similarity or commonality.
Often used for spreading news or ideas, sometimes with a formal or negative connotation.
Refers to moral wrongdoing or wickedness.
Often used to emphasize a negation that follows.
Common phrase in biblical warnings, equivalent to 'woe to them'.
Indicates a change of state or new situation.

verses.text: 你們要告訴義人，他們必得福樂，因為他們必享自己行為所結的果子。

words.note: Refers to a person who is just and upright, often in a religious sense.
Often used in religious contexts to describe spiritual well-being.
Forms a nominal phrase like 'that which is done'.
Often used metaphorically for the results or consequences of actions.

verses.text: 惡人卻有禍了，他們必遭災難，因為他們必按自己手所作的得報應。

words.note: Often used in the phrase '有禍了' (woe to...)
'所' nominalizes the following verb.
Often refers to divine justice or karma.

verses.text: 至於我的子民，孩童欺壓他們，婦女管轄他們；我的子民啊！那引導你們的，使你們走錯了路，並且混亂了你們所走的方向。

words.note: Commonly used in the Bible for God's chosen people.
Commonly used in the Bible for God's chosen people.

words.definition: the path walked, what is walked
words.note: '所' nominalizes the following verb.

verses.text: 耶和華起來辯論，站著審判人民。

words.note: Transliteration of Hebrew YHWH.
In a legal/judicial context, to present a case.
Can be a noun (judgment) or a verb (to judge).

verses.text: 耶和華必審問他子民中的長老和領袖，說：「那吞盡葡萄園的，就是你們；從貧窮人那裡掠奪的，都在你們家中。」

words.note: Transliteration of Hebrew YHWH.
Commonly used in the Bible for God's chosen people.
Refers to respected leaders in a community or church.

verses.text: 主萬軍之耶和華說：「你們為甚麼壓迫我的子民，搓磨貧窮人的臉呢？」

words.note: A title for God or Jesus in the Bible.
A divine title emphasizing God's power and sovereignty over all armies/heavenly beings.
Commonly used in the Bible for God's chosen people.
Figuratively, to treat harshly or exploit.
Figuratively, to shame or demean someone.

verses.text: 耶和華又說：「因為錫安的女子高傲，走路挺直頸項，媚眼看人，俏步徐行，用腳發出叮噹聲。

words.note: God's covenant name.

verses.heading: Washing Away Impurity

verses.text: 因此，主必使錫安的女子頭頂長出禿瘡；耶和華又使她們露出前額。」

words.note: Refers to God or the Messiah.
Refers to a diseased scalp or scabs causing baldness.
God's covenant name.

verses.text: 到那日，主必除掉她們華美的腳釧、髮網、月牙圈、

words.note: Refers to a specific prophetic future day.
Refers to God or the Messiah.
An ancient form of foot or ankle jewelry.
An ancient hair ornament for women.
Crescent-shaped ornaments, possibly amulets or jewelry.

verses.text: 耳墜、手鐲、蒙臉的帕子、

words.note: Refers to a head covering or veil.

verses.text: 頭飾、腳環、華帶、香盒、符囊、

words.note: Luxurious sashes worn as fashion accessories.
Small containers for perfumes or aromatics.
Pouches containing charms or magical objects.

verses.text: 戒指、鼻環、
美服、外衣、錢袋、
鏡子、細麻襯衣、頭巾、蒙身帕子。

words.note: A specific type of garment mentioned in ancient texts.
Describes a veil specifically for covering the body.

verses.text: 必有腐臭代替馨香，繩子代替腰帶，光禿代替美髮，麻衣繫腰代替美服，烙痕代替美貌。

words.note: Often refers to the sweet aroma of offerings or incense.
Often associated with mourning or repentance in the Bible.

verses.text: 你的男丁要倒在刀下，你的勇士必死在戰場。

words.note: Often refers to male population, especially those capable of serving.
Idiomatic for dying in battle.

verses.text: 錫安的城門必悲哀哭號，錫安被掠奪，成了一片荒涼後，必坐在地上。

words.note: 成 (become) + 了 (completion particle)

words.definition: a stretch of, an expanse of
